df-card
blocks.content: Define the cardinal number function. The cardinal number of a set is the least ordinal number equinumerous to it. In other words, it is the "size" of the set. Definition of [Enderton] p. 197. See ~ cardval for its value and ~ cardval2 for a simpler version of its value. The principal theorem relating cardinality to equinumerosity is ~ carden . Our notation is from Enderton. Other textbooks often use a double bar over the set to express this function. (Contributed by NM, 21-Oct-2003.)

blocks.name: df-aleph
blocks.content: Define the aleph function. Our definition expresses Definition 12 of [Suppes] p. 229 in a closed form, from which we derive the recursive definition as theorems ~ aleph0 , ~ alephsuc , and ~ alephlim . The aleph function provides a one-to-one, onto mapping from the ordinal numbers to the infinite cardinal numbers. Roughly, any aleph is the smallest infinite cardinal number whose size is strictly greater than any aleph before it. (Contributed by NM, 21-Oct-2003.)

blocks.name: df-cf
blocks.content: Define the cofinality function. Definition B of Saharon Shelah, _Cardinal Arithmetic_ (1994), p. xxx (Roman numeral 30). See ~ cfval for its value and a description. (Contributed by NM, 1-Apr-2004.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-cf(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(ccf, cmpt(s0, con0, cint(cab(s1, wex(s2, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cfv(ccrd, cv(s2))), wa(wss(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wral(s3, cv(s0), wrex(s4, cv(s2), wss(cv(s3), cv(s4)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
}

blocks.name: df-acn
blocks.content: Define a local and length-limited version of the axiom of choice. The definition of the predicate ` X e. AC_ A ` is that for all families of nonempty subsets of ` X ` indexed on ` A ` (i.e. functions ` A --> ~P X \ { (/) } ` ), there is a function which selects an element from each set in the family. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)

  |- wceq(wacn(c0), cab(s0, wa(wcel(c0, universe), wral(s1, co(cdif(cpw(cv(s0)), csn(emptycls)), cmap, c0), wex(s2, wral(s3, c0, wcel(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s2)

  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s3, c0)
}

blocks.name: cardon
blocks.content: The cardinal number of a set is an ordinal number. Proposition 10.6(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 85. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: isnum2
blocks.content: A way to express well-orderability without bound or distinct variables. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 28-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:

  |- wb(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wrex(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0)))

  bitri(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wrex(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0)), wcel(c0, cab(hs0, wrex(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0))))))

  cardf2(hs0, s0)
  elab3(hs0, c0, wrex(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0))), wrex(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0)))
  rexlimivw(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0), wcel(c0, universe))
  brrelex2i(cv(s0), cen, c0)
  relen()
  rexbidv(s0, con0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0))
  breq2(cv(hs0), c0, cv(s0), cen)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wrex(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)

blocks.name: isnumi
blocks.content: A set equinumerous to an ordinal is numerable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: ennum
blocks.content: Equinumerous sets are equi-numerable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: finnum
blocks.content: Every finite set is numerable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Feb-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: onenon
blocks.content: Every ordinal number is numerable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: tskwe
blocks.content: A Tarski set is well-orderable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: xpnum
blocks.content: The cartesian product of numerable sets is numerable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Mar-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm xpnum(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd))), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cdm(ccrd)))
} = {
  syl2anb(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cdm(ccrd)), wrex(hs0, con0, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c0)), wrex(hs1, con0, wbr(cv(hs1), cen, c1)))
  isnum2(hs0, c0)
  isnum2(hs1, c1)
  sylbir(wa(wrex(hs0, con0, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c0)), wrex(hs1, con0, wbr(cv(hs1), cen, c1))), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cdm(ccrd)), wrex(hs0, con0, wrex(hs1, con0, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c0), wbr(cv(hs1), cen, c1)))))
  reeanv(hs0, hs1, con0, con0, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c0), wbr(cv(hs1), cen, c1))
  rexlimivv(hs0, hs1, con0, con0, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c0), wbr(cv(hs1), cen, c1)), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cdm(ccrd)))
  ex(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs1), con0)), wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c0), wbr(cv(hs1), cen, c1)), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cdm(ccrd)))
  syl2an2r(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs1), con0)), wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c0), wbr(cv(hs1), cen, c1)), wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cdm(ccrd)), wcel(co(cv(hs0), comu, cv(hs1)), con0), wbr(co(cv(hs0), comu, cv(hs1)), cen, cxp(c0, c1)))
  omcl(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  syl2an(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs1), con0)), wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c0), wbr(cv(hs1), cen, c1)), wbr(co(cv(hs0), comu, cv(hs1)), cen, cxp(c0, c1)), wbr(co(cv(hs0), comu, cv(hs1)), cen, cxp(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wbr(cxp(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cen, cxp(c0, c1)))
  omxpen(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  xpen(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1), c1)
  entr(co(cv(hs0), comu, cv(hs1)), cxp(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), cxp(c0, c1))
  isnumi(co(cv(hs0), comu, cv(hs1)), cxp(c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(con0)
  diff.hs1.c(con0)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(cv(hs1), cen, c1))
  diff.hs1.w(wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cdm(ccrd)))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(cxp(c0, c1), cdm(ccrd)))
}

  elex(c0, cdm(ccrd))

  3bitr2i(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(cint(crab(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0))), universe), wrex(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0)), wne(crab(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0)), emptycls))
  isnum2(s0, c0)

  inteqd(crab(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0))), crab(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  rabbidv(s0, con0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wbr(cv(s0), cen, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0))

blocks.name: isnum3
blocks.content: A set is numerable iff it is equinumerous with its cardinal. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: oncardval
blocks.content: The value of the cardinal number function with an ordinal number as its argument. Unlike ~ cardval , this theorem does not require the Axiom of Choice. (Contributed by NM, 24-Nov-2003.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: oncardid
blocks.content: Any ordinal number is equinumerous to its cardinal number. Unlike ~ cardid , this theorem does not require the Axiom of Choice. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jul-2004.)

blocks.name: cardonle
blocks.content: The cardinal of an ordinal number is less than or equal to the ordinal number. Proposition 10.6(3) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 85. (Contributed by NM, 22-Oct-2003.)

blocks.name: card0
blocks.content: The cardinality of the empty set is the empty set. (Contributed by NM, 25-Oct-2003.)

  syl6bb((card ` c0)= ‚àÖ, c0[‚âÖ](card ` c0), c0 = ‚àÖ, c0[‚âÖ]‚àÖ)
  breq2((card ` c0), emptycls, c0, cen)
  en0(c0)
  syl6eq((card ` c0), emptycls, (card ` ‚àÖ), c0 = ‚àÖ)
  fveq2(c0, emptycls, ccrd)
  card0()
}

blocks.name: cardne
blocks.content: No member of a cardinal number of a set is equinumerous to the set. Proposition 10.6(2) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 85. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jan-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm cardne(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wn(wbr(c0, cen, c1)))

  elfvdm(c0, ccrd, c1)
  pm2.43d(wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wn(wbr(c0, cen, c1)))
  ex(wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wn(wbr(c0, cen, c1))))
  con2d(wa(wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1))), wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wbr(c0, cen, c1))
  sylibd(wa(wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1))), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wn(wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1))), wss(cfv(ccrd, c1), c0))
  sylibrd(wa(wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1))), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wss(cfv(ccrd, c1), c0), wss(cint(crab(hs0, con0, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c1))), c0))
  adantl(wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wi(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wss(cint(crab(hs0, con0, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c1))), c0)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wi(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wss(cint(crab(hs0, con0, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c1))), c0)), wcel(c0, con0))
  onintss(hs0, c0, wbr(c0, cen, c1), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c1))
  breq1(cv(hs0), c0, cen, c1)
  adantr(wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wb(wss(cfv(ccrd, c1), c0), wss(cint(crab(hs0, con0, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c1))), c0)))
  sseq1d(cfv(ccrd, c1), c0, cint(crab(hs0, con0, wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c1))), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)))
  cardval3(hs0, c1)
  adantl(wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wb(wss(cfv(ccrd, c1), c0), wn(wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)))))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wb(wss(cfv(ccrd, c1), c0), wn(wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)))), wcel(cfv(ccrd, c1), con0), wcel(c0, con0))
  oneli(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1))
  cardon(c1)
  ontri1(cfv(ccrd, c1), c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c0, cen, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)

blocks.name: carden2a
blocks.content: If two sets have equal nonzero cardinalities, then they are equinumerous. (This assertion and ~ carden2b are meant to replace ~ carden in ZF without AC.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Jan-2013.)

thm carden2a(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wne(cfv(ccrd, c0), emptycls)), wbr(c0, cen, c1))

  df-ne(cfv(ccrd, c0), emptycls)
  mpd(wa(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wn(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), emptycls))), wbr(c0, cen, c1), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c1), cen, c1))
  syl(wa(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wn(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), emptycls))), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c1), cen, c1), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)))
  imp(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wn(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), emptycls)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)))
  con1d(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), emptycls), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)))
  syl5ibr(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wn(wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd))), wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), emptycls), wceq(cfv(ccrd, c1), emptycls))
  ndmfv(c1, ccrd)
  eqeq1(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1), emptycls)
  cardid2(c1)
  impel(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wn(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), emptycls)), wi(wbr(cfv(ccrd, c1), cen, c1), wbr(c0, cen, c1)), wbr(c0, cen, cfv(ccrd, c0)))
  syl6bi(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wbr(c0, cen, cfv(ccrd, c0)), wi(wbr(cfv(ccrd, c1), cen, c1), wbr(c0, cen, c1)), wbr(c0, cen, cfv(ccrd, c1)))
  breq2(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1), c0, cen)
  ex(wbr(c0, cen, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c1), cen, c1), wbr(c0, cen, c1))
  entr(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1), c1)
  ensymd(c0, cfv(ccrd, c0), wn(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), emptycls)))
  nsyl4(wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), emptycls), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c0), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))
  cardid2(c0)
  ndmfv(c0, ccrd)
}

  nsyl3(wa(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd))), wcel(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c1))
  cardne(cfv(ccrd, c0), c1)
  syl2anr(wbr(c0, cen, c1), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c1), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c0), wbr(c0, cen, c1))

blocks.name: cardsdomelir
blocks.content: A cardinal strictly dominates its members. Equivalent to Proposition 10.37 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 93. This is half of the assertion ~ cardsdomel and can be proven without the AC. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jan-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm cardsdomelir(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wbr(c0, csdm, c1))

  onelssi(c0, cfv(ccrd, c1))

  con2d(wcel(c0, con0), wbr(c0, csdm, cfv(ccrd, c1)), wss(cfv(ccrd, c1), c0))
  sylibd(wcel(c0, con0), wss(cfv(ccrd, c1), c0), wn(wbr(c0, csdm, cfv(ccrd, c1))), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c1), cdom, c0))
  ssdomg(c0, con0, cfv(ccrd, c1))

  impbid(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd))), wss(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wbr(c0, cdom, c1))

  onelssi(cfv(ccrd, c1), cfv(ccrd, c0))

blocks.name: cardprc
blocks.content: The class of all cardinal numbers is not a set (i.e. is a proper class). Theorem 19.8 of [Eisenberg] p. 310. In this proof (which does not use AC), we cannot use Cantor's construction ~ canth3 to ensure that there is always a cardinal larger than a given cardinal, but we can use Hartogs' construction ~ hartogs to construct (effectively) ` ( aleph `` suc A ) ` from ` ( aleph `` A ) ` , which achieves the same thing. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Jan-2013.)
blocks.origin:

  cbvabv(s0, hs0, wceq(cfv(ccrd, cv(s0)), cv(s0)), wceq(cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), cv(hs0)))
  eqeq12d(cfv(ccrd, cv(s0)), cv(s0), cfv(ccrd, cv(hs0)), cv(hs0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  fveq2(cv(s0), cv(hs0), ccrd)
  id(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))

blocks.name: cardennn
blocks.content: If ` A ` is equinumerous to a natural number, then that number is its cardinal. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Jan-2013.)

blocks.name: cardsucinf
blocks.content: The cardinality of the successor of an infinite ordinal. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Jan-2013.)

blocks.name: cardsucnn
blocks.content: The cardinality of the successor of a finite ordinal (natural number). This theorem does not hold for infinite ordinals; see ~ cardsucinf . (Contributed by NM, 7-Nov-2008.)

blocks.name: cardom
blocks.content: The set of natural numbers is a cardinal number. Theorem 18.11 of [Monk1] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 28-Oct-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm cardom() {
  |- wceq(cfv(ccrd, com), com)
} = {
  mtpor(wceq(cfv(ccrd, com), com), wcel(cfv(ccrd, com), com))
  mt2(wcel(cfv(ccrd, com), com), wbr(cfv(ccrd, com), cen, com))
  ax-mp(wbr(cfv(ccrd, com), cen, com), wcel(com, con0))
  oncardid(com)
  syl(wcel(cfv(ccrd, com), com), wn(wbr(cfv(ccrd, com), cen, com)), wbr(cfv(ccrd, com), csdm, com))
  nnsdom(cfv(ccrd, com))
  sdomnen(cfv(ccrd, com), com)
  mpbi(wo(wcel(cfv(ccrd, com), com), wceq(cfv(ccrd, com), com)), wss(cfv(ccrd, com), com))
  ax-mp(wss(cfv(ccrd, com), com), wcel(com, con0))
  cardonle(com)
  onsseli(cfv(ccrd, com), com)
  cardon(com)
  omelon()
}

blocks.name: carden2
blocks.content: Two numerable sets are equinumerous iff their cardinal numbers are equal. Unlike ~ carden , the Axiom of Choice is not required. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: cardsdom2
blocks.content: A numerable set is strictly dominated by another iff their cardinalities are strictly ordered. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Oct-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm cardsdom2(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd))), wb(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wbr(c0, csdm, c1)))
} = {
  3bitr4g(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd))), wcel(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wbr(c0, csdm, c1), wa(wss(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wne(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1))), wa(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wn(wbr(c0, cen, c1))))
  anbi12d(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd))), wss(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wne(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wn(wbr(c0, cen, c1)))
  carddom2(c0, c1)
  necon3abid(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd))), wbr(c0, cen, c1))
  carden2(c0, c1)
  mp2an(wb(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wa(wss(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wne(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)))), wcel(cfv(ccrd, c0), con0), wcel(cfv(ccrd, c1), con0))
  cardon(c0)
  cardon(c1)
  onelpss(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1))
  brsdom(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: domtri2
blocks.content: Trichotomy of dominance for numerable sets (does not use AC). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm domtri2(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd))), wb(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wn(wbr(c1, csdm, c0))))
} = {

  ancoms(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)), wb(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c1), cfv(ccrd, c0)), wbr(c1, csdm, c0)))

blocks.name: nnsdomel
blocks.content: Strict dominance and elementhood are the same for finite ordinals. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm nnsdomel(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)), wb(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c0, csdm, c1)))
} = {
  bitr3d(wa(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com)), wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c0, csdm, c1), wcel(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)))

  cardnn(c0)
  cardnn(c1)
  eleq12(cfv(ccrd, c0), c0, cfv(ccrd, c1), c1)
  syl2an(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c1, com), wb(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c1)), wbr(c0, csdm, c1)), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)))
  syl(wcel(c0, com), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c0, con0))
  nnon(c0)
  onenon(c0)
  syl(wcel(c1, com), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c1, con0))
  nnon(c1)
  onenon(c1)
  cardsdom2(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: cardval2
blocks.content: An alternate version of the value of the cardinal number of a set. Compare ~ cardval . This theorem could be used to give a simpler definition of ` card ` in place of ~ df-card . It apparently does not occur in the literature. (Contributed by NM, 7-Nov-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm cardval2(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wceq(cfv(ccrd, c0), crab(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, c0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  syl6eqr(cfv(ccrd, c0), crab(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, c0)), cab(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), con0), wbr(cv(s0), csdm, c0))), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))
  abbi2dv(s0, cfv(ccrd, c0), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), con0), wbr(cv(s0), csdm, c0)))

blocks.content: Trichotomy of dominance without AC when one set is finite. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Oct-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fidomtri(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2)), wb(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wn(wbr(c1, csdm, c0))))
} = {
  impbid2(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2)), wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wn(wbr(c1, csdm, c0)))
  domnsym(c0, c1)
  pm2.61dan(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2)), wi(wn(wbr(c1, csdm, c0)), wbr(c0, cdom, c1)), wcel(c1, cfn))
  biimprd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(c1, cfn)), wn(wbr(c1, csdm, c0)), wbr(c0, cdom, c1))
  syl2an(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(c1, cfn), wb(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wn(wbr(c1, csdm, c0))), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))
  finnum(c0)
  finnum(c1)
  domtri2(c0, c1)
  a1d(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2)), wn(wcel(c1, cfn))), wn(wbr(c1, csdm, c0)), wbr(c0, cdom, c1))
  mpbird(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2)), wn(wcel(c1, cfn))), wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wex(hs0, wf1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)))
  adantlr(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2), wn(wcel(c1, cfn)), wex(hs0, wf1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)))
  ancoms(wcel(c0, cfn), wn(wcel(c1, cfn)), wex(hs0, wf1(cv(hs0), c0, c1)))
  isinffi(hs0, c1, c0)
  ad2antlr(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2), wn(wcel(c1, cfn)), wb(wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wex(hs0, wf1(cv(hs0), c0, c1))))
  brdomg(hs0, c1, c2, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: harsdom
blocks.content: The Hartogs number of a well-orderable set strictly dominates the set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-May-2015.)

blocks.name: onsdom
blocks.content: Any well-orderable set is strictly dominated by an ordinal number. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 22-Oct-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 15-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm onsdom(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wrex(s0, con0, wbr(c0, csdm, cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wrex(s0, con0, wbr(c0, csdm, cv(s0))), wcel(cfv(char, c0), con0), wbr(c0, csdm, cfv(char, c0)))
  harcl(c0)
  harsdom(c0)
  rspcev(s0, cfv(char, c0), con0, wbr(c0, csdm, cfv(char, c0)), wbr(c0, csdm, cv(s0)))
  breq2(cv(s0), cfv(char, c0), c0, csdm)
  diff.con0.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, c0, csdm, cfv(char, c0))
  diff.csdm.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, char, c0)
  diff.char.s(s0)
}

  diff.cfv.s(s0, char, c0)

}

blocks.name: pm54.43lem
blocks.content: In Theorem *54.43 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 360, the number 1 is defined as the collection of all sets with cardinality 1 (i.e. all singletons; see ~ card1 ), so that their ` A e. 1 ` means, in our notation, ` A e. { x | ( card `` x ) = 1o } ` . Here we show that this is equivalent to ` A ~~ 1o ` so that we can use the latter more convenient notation in ~ pm54.43 . (Contributed by NM, 4-Nov-2013.)

blocks.name: pm54.43
blocks.content: Theorem *54.43 of [WhiteheadRussell] p. 360. "From this proposition it will follow, when arithmetical addition has been defined, that 1+1=2." See ~ http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principia_Mathematica#Quotations . This theorem states that two sets of cardinality 1 are disjoint iff their union has cardinality 2. Whitehead and Russell define 1 as the collection of all sets with cardinality 1 (i.e. all singletons; see ~ card1 ), so that their ` A e. 1 ` means, in our notation, ` A e. { x | ( card `` x ) = 1o } ` which is the same as ` A ~~ 1o ` by ~ pm54.43lem . We do not have several of their earlier lemmas available (which would otherwise be unused by our different approach to arithmetic), so our proof is longer. (It is also longer because we must show every detail.) Theorem ~ pm110.643 shows the derivation of 1+1=2 for cardinal numbers from this theorem. (Contributed by NM, 4-Apr-2007.)

thm pr2nelem(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wne(c0, c2)), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))
} = {
  3imp(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wne(c0, c2), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))
  syl7(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wne(c0, c2), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o), wceq(cin(csn(c0), csn(c2)), emptycls))
  disjsn2(c0, c2)
  ex(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wi(wceq(cin(csn(c0), csn(c2)), emptycls), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o)))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wi(wceq(cin(csn(c0), csn(c2)), emptycls), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o)), wbr(csn(c0), cen, c1o), wbr(csn(c2), cen, c1o))
  ensn1g(c0, c1)
  ensn1g(c2, c3)
  biimpd(wa(wbr(csn(c0), cen, c1o), wbr(csn(c2), cen, c1o)), wceq(cin(csn(c0), csn(c2)), emptycls), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))
  syl6bbr(wa(wbr(csn(c0), cen, c1o), wbr(csn(c2), cen, c1o)), wceq(cin(csn(c0), csn(c2)), emptycls), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o), wbr(cun(csn(c0), csn(c2)), cen, c2o))

  breq1i(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o, cun(csn(c0), csn(c2)))
  df-pr(c0, c2)

blocks.name: pr2ne
blocks.content: If an unordered pair has two elements they are different. (Contributed by FL, 14-Feb-2010.)

thm pr2ne(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wb(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o), wne(c0, c2)))
} = {
  impbid(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o), wne(c0, c2))
  necon2ad(c0, c2, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))
  syl5(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(c0, c2), wn(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o)), wceq(cpr(c0, c2), cpr(c0, c0)))
  eqcoms(c0, c2, wceq(cpr(c0, c2), cpr(c0, c0)))
  preq2(c2, c0, c0)
  pm2.43a(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wceq(cpr(c0, c2), cpr(c0, c0)), wn(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o)))
  imp(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wi(wceq(cpr(c0, c2), cpr(c0, c0)), wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wn(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o)))))
  com23(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(cpr(c0, c2), cpr(c0, c0)), wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wn(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))))
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wceq(cpr(c0, c2), cpr(c0, c0)), wi(wcel(c2, c3), wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wn(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))))), wbr(cpr(c0, c0), cen, c1o))
  enpr1g(c0, c1)
  a1dd(wbr(cpr(c0, c0), cen, c1o), wceq(cpr(c0, c2), cpr(c0, c0)), wcel(c2, c3), wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wn(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))))
  syl11(wbr(cpr(c0, c0), cen, c1o), wceq(cpr(c0, c2), cpr(c0, c0)), wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wn(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, cpr(c0, c0)))
  ex(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, cpr(c0, c0)), wbr(cpr(c0, c0), cen, c1o), wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wn(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))))
  syl(wa(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, cpr(c0, c0)), wbr(cpr(c0, c0), cen, c1o)), wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wn(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c1o))
  entr(cpr(c0, c2), cpr(c0, c0), c1o)
  a1d(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c1o), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wn(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o)))
  mtoi(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c1o), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o), wbr(c1o, cen, c2o))
  ax-mp(wn(wbr(c1o, cen, c2o)), wbr(c1o, csdm, c2o))
  1sdom2()
  sdomnen(c1o, c2o)
  syl(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c1o), wi(wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o), wbr(c1o, cen, c2o)), wbr(c1o, cen, cpr(c0, c2)))
  ensym(cpr(c0, c2), c1o)
  ex(wbr(c1o, cen, cpr(c0, c2)), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o), wbr(c1o, cen, c2o))
  entr(c1o, cpr(c0, c2), c2o)
  ax-mp(wi(wceq(cpr(c0, c2), cpr(c0, c0)), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, cpr(c0, c0))), wcel(cpr(c0, c2), universe))
  prex(c0, c2)
  eqeng(cpr(c0, c2), universe, cpr(c0, c0))
  3expia(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wne(c0, c2), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))
  pr2nelem(c0, c1, c2, c3)
}

blocks.name: prdom2
blocks.content: An unordered pair has at most two elements. (Contributed by FL, 22-Feb-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm prdom2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cdom, c2o))
} = {
  pm2.61ine(c0, c2, wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cdom, c2o)))
  adantrd(wceq(c0, c2), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cdom, c2o))
  eqcoms(c0, c2, wi(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cdom, c2o)))
  syl5ibr(wceq(c2, c0), wcel(c0, c1), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cdom, c2o), wbr(cpr(c0, c0), cdom, c2o))
  syl5eqbrr(cpr(c0, c0), cdom, c2o, csn(c0), wcel(c0, c1))
  dfsn2(c0)
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(csn(c0), cdom, c2o), wbr(csn(c0), cen, c1o))
  ensn1g(c0, c1)
  sylancl(wbr(csn(c0), cen, c1o), wbr(csn(c0), cdom, c2o), wbr(csn(c0), cdom, c1o), wbr(c1o, csdm, c2o))
  endom(csn(c0), c1o)
  1sdom2()
  syl(wa(wbr(csn(c0), cdom, c1o), wbr(c1o, csdm, c2o)), wbr(csn(c0), cdom, c2o), wbr(csn(c0), csdm, c2o))
  domsdomtr(csn(c0), c1o, c2o)
  sdomdom(csn(c0), c2o)
  breq1d(cpr(c0, c2), cdom, c2o, cpr(c0, c0), wceq(c2, c0))
  preq2(c2, c0, c0)
  syl6com(wne(c0, c2), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cdom, c2o), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))
  biimprd(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wne(c0, c2), wbr(cpr(c0, c2), cen, c2o))
  pr2ne(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  endom(cpr(c0, c2), c2o)
}

blocks.name: en2eqpr
blocks.content: Building a set with two elements. (Contributed by FL, 11-Aug-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm en2eqpr(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wbr(c0, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0)), wi(wne(c1, c2), wceq(c0, cpr(c1, c2))))
} = {
  ex(w3a(wbr(c0, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0)), wne(c1, c2), wceq(c0, cpr(c1, c2)))
  eqcomd(c0, cpr(c1, c2), wa(w3a(wbr(c0, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0)), wne(c1, c2)))
  syl3anc(wa(w3a(wbr(c0, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), wceq(cpr(c1, c2), c0), wcel(c0, cfn), wss(cpr(c1, c2), c0), wbr(cpr(c1, c2), cen, c0))
  sylancr(wa(w3a(wbr(c0, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c2o, cfn), wbr(c0, cen, c2o))
  ax-mp(wcel(c2o, cfn), wcel(c2o, com))
  2onn()
  nnfi(c2o)
  enfii(c2o, c0)
  prssd(c1, c2, c0, wa(w3a(wbr(c0, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0)), wne(c1, c2)))
  simpl2(wbr(c0, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0), wne(c1, c2))
  simpl3(wbr(c0, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0), wne(c1, c2))
  syl2anc(wa(w3a(wbr(c0, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0)), wne(c1, c2)), wbr(cpr(c1, c2), cen, c0), wbr(cpr(c1, c2), cen, c2o), wbr(c2o, cen, c0))
  3adantl1(wbr(c0, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0), wne(c1, c2), wbr(cpr(c1, c2), cen, c2o))
  3expa(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0), wne(c1, c2), wbr(cpr(c1, c2), cen, c2o))
  pr2nelem(c1, c0, c2, c0)
  ensymd(c2o, c0, wa(w3a(wbr(c0, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0)), wne(c1, c2)))
  simpl1(wbr(c0, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(c2, c0), wne(c1, c2))
  entr(cpr(c1, c2), c2o, c0)
  fisseneq(c0, cpr(c1, c2))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm en2eqpr(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0[‚âÖ]2o ‚àß c1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚Üí(c1 ‚â† c2 ‚Üí c0 = { c1, c2 }))
} = {
  ex((c0[‚âÖ]2o ‚àß c1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c0), c1 ‚â† c2, c0 = { c1, c2 })
  eqcomd(c0, { c1, c2 }, ((c0[‚âÖ]2o ‚àß c1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚àß c1 ‚â† c2))
  syl3anc(((c0[‚âÖ]2o ‚àß c1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚àß c1 ‚â† c2), { c1, c2 } = c0, c0 ‚àà Fin, { c1, c2 } ‚äÜ c0, { c1, c2 }[‚âÖ]c0)
  sylancr(((c0[‚âÖ]2o ‚àß c1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚àß c1 ‚â† c2), c0 ‚àà Fin, 2o ‚àà Fin, c0[‚âÖ]2o)
  ax-mp(2o ‚àà Fin, 2o ‚àà _om)
  2onn()
  nnfi(c2o)
  enfii(c2o, c0)
  prssd(c1, c2, c0, ((c0[‚âÖ]2o ‚àß c1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚àß c1 ‚â† c2))
  simpl2(c0[‚âÖ]2o, c1 ‚àà c0, c2 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚â† c2)
  simpl3(c0[‚âÖ]2o, c1 ‚àà c0, c2 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚â† c2)
  syl2anc(((c0[‚âÖ]2o ‚àß c1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚àß c1 ‚â† c2), { c1, c2 }[‚âÖ]c0, { c1, c2 }[‚âÖ]2o, 2o[‚âÖ]c0)
  3adantl1(c0[‚âÖ]2o, c1 ‚àà c0, c2 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚â† c2, { c1, c2 }[‚âÖ]2o)
  3expa(c1 ‚àà c0, c2 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚â† c2, { c1, c2 }[‚âÖ]2o)
  pr2nelem(c1, c0, c2, c0)
  ensymd(c2o, c0, ((c0[‚âÖ]2o ‚àß c1 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c0)‚àß c1 ‚â† c2))
  simpl1(c0[‚âÖ]2o, c1 ‚àà c0, c2 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚â† c2)
  entr({ c1, c2 }, c2o, c0)
  fisseneq(c0, { c1, c2 })
}

blocks.name: en2eleq
blocks.content: Express a set of pair cardinality as the unordered pair of a given element and the other element. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 22-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm en2eleq(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wceq(c1, cpr(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))))))
} = {
  eqcomd(c1, cpr(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wceq(cpr(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))), c1), wcel(c1, cfn), wss(cpr(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))), c1), wbr(cpr(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))), cen, c1))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, cfn))
  mpbiri(wbr(c1, cen, c2o), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c2o, cfn))
  ax-mp(wcel(c2o, cfn), wcel(c2o, com))
  2onn()
  nnfi(c2o)
  enfi(c1, c2o)
  prssd(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c1, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wbr(cpr(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))), cen, c1), wbr(cpr(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))), cen, c2o), wbr(c2o, cen, c1))
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wbr(cpr(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))), cen, c2o), wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c1), wne(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))))
  simpld(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wcel(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c1), wne(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c0))
  necomd(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  simprd(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wne(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c0), wcel(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c1))
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wa(wcel(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c1), wne(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c0)), wcel(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), cdif(c1, csn(c0))))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wcel(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), cdif(c1, csn(c0))), wbr(cdif(c1, csn(c0)), cen, c1o))
  mp3an2i(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wbr(cdif(c1, csn(c0)), cen, c1o), wcel(c1o, com), wbr(c1, cen, csuc(c1o)), wcel(c0, c1))
  1onn()
  syl6breq(c1, cen, csuc(c1o), c2o, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o))
  df-2o()
  simpl(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o))
  dif1en(c1o, c1, c0)
  en1uniel(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))
  eldifsn(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c1, c0)
  pr2nelem(c0, c1, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o), wbr(c2o, cen, c1))
  ensym(c1, c2o)
  entr(cpr(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))), c2o, c1)
  fisseneq(c1, cpr(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))))
}

thm en2eleq(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o)‚Üí c1 = { c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })})
} = {
  eqcomd(c1, { c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })}, (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o))
  syl3anc((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o), { c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })} = c1, c1 ‚àà Fin, { c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })} ‚äÜ c1, { c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })}[‚âÖ]c1)
  adantl(c0 ‚àà c1, c1[‚âÖ]2o, c1 ‚àà Fin)
  mpbiri(c1[‚âÖ]2o, c1 ‚àà Fin, 2o ‚àà Fin)
  ax-mp(2o ‚àà Fin, 2o ‚àà _om)
  2onn()
  nnfi(c2o)
  enfi(c1, c2o)
  prssd(c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 }), c1, (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o))
  syl2anc((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o), { c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })}[‚âÖ]c1, { c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })}[‚âÖ]2o, 2o[‚âÖ]c1)
  syl3anc((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o), { c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })}[‚âÖ]2o, c0 ‚àà c1, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })‚àà c1, c0 ‚â† ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 }))
  simpld((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o), ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })‚àà c1, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })‚â† c0)
  necomd(c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 }), (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o))
  simprd((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o), ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })‚â† c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })‚àà c1)
  sylib((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o), (‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })‚àà c1 ‚àß ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })‚â† c0), ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })‚àà(c1 \ { c0 }))
  syl((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o), ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })‚àà(c1 \ { c0 }), (c1 \ { c0 })[‚âÖ]1o)
  mp3an2i((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o), (c1 \ { c0 })[‚âÖ]1o, 1o ‚àà _om, c1[‚âÖ]suc(1o), c0 ‚àà c1)
  1onn()
  syl6breq(c1, cen, suc(1o), c2o, (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o))
  simpr(c0 ‚àà c1, c1[‚âÖ]2o)
  df-2o()
  simpl(c0 ‚àà c1, c1[‚âÖ]2o)
  dif1en(c1o, c1, c0)
  en1uniel((c1 \ { c0 }))
  eldifsn(‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 }), c1, c0)
  pr2nelem(c0, c1, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 }), c1)
  adantl(c0 ‚àà c1, c1[‚âÖ]2o, 2o[‚âÖ]c1)
  ensym(c1, c2o)
  entr({ c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })}, c2o, c1)
  fisseneq(c1, { c0, ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })})
}

blocks.name: en2other2
blocks.content: Taking the other element twice in a pair gets back to the original element. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 22-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm en2other2(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wceq(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))))), c0))
} = {
  eqtrd(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))))), c0, cuni(csn(c0)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  unieqd(cdif(c1, csn(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))))), csn(c0), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  eqssd(cdif(c1, csn(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))))), csn(c0), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  syl6eqss(cdif(c1, csn(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))))), csn(c0), cdif(cpr(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c0), csn(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  difeq1d(c1, csn(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))), cpr(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c0), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  syl6eq(c1, cpr(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c0), cpr(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  en2eleq(c0, c1)
  prcom(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))))
  difprsnss(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c0)
  snssd(c0, cdif(c1, csn(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wcel(c0, cdif(c1, csn(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))))), wcel(c0, c1), wne(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))))
  necomd(c0, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  3syl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wne(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c0), wbr(cdif(c1, csn(c0)), cen, c1o), wcel(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), cdif(c1, csn(c0))))
  mp3an2i(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)), wbr(cdif(c1, csn(c0)), cen, c1o), wcel(c1o, com), wbr(c1, cen, csuc(c1o)), wcel(c0, c1))
  1onn()
  syl6breq(c1, cen, csuc(c1o), c2o, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o))
  df-2o()
  simpl(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o))
  dif1en(c1o, c1, c0)
  en1uniel(cdif(c1, csn(c0)))
  eldifsni(cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))), c1, c0)
  eldifsn(c0, c1, cuni(cdif(c1, csn(c0))))
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c1, cen, c2o), wceq(cuni(csn(c0)), c0))
  unisng(c0, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm en2other2(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o)‚Üí ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })})= c0)
} = {
  eqtrd(‚ãÉ(c1 \ { ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })}), c0, ‚ãÉ { c0 }, (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o))
  unieqd((c1 \ { ‚ãÉ(c1 \ { c0 })}), { c0 }, (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c1[‚âÖ]2o))

blocks.name: dif1card
blocks.content: The cardinality of a nonempty finite set is one greater than the cardinality of the set with one element removed. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 2-Feb-2013.)

Note that unlike ~ r0weon , this order is _not_ set-like, as the preimage of ` <. 1o , (/) >. ` is the proper class ` ( { (/) } X. On ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Mar-2013.)

blocks.content: A set-like well-ordering of the class of ordinal pairs. Proposition 7.58(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 54. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Mar-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: infxpen
blocks.content: Every infinite ordinal is equinumerous to its Cartesian square. Proposition 10.39 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 94, whose proof we follow closely. The key idea is to show that the relation ` R ` is a well-ordering of ` ( On X. On ) ` with the additional property that ` R ` -initial segments of ` ( x X. x ) ` (where ` x ` is a limit ordinal) are of cardinality at most ` x ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Mar-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: xpomen
blocks.content: The Cartesian product of omega (the set of ordinal natural numbers) with itself is equinumerous to omega. Exercise 1 of [Enderton] p. 133. (Contributed by NM, 23-Jul-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 9-Mar-2013.)

blocks.name: xpct
blocks.content: The cartesian product of two countable sets is countable. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 24-Sep-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm xpct(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wbr(c0, cdom, com), wbr(c1, cdom, com)), wbr(cxp(c0, c1), cdom, com))
} = {
  sylancl(wa(wbr(c0, cdom, com), wbr(c1, cdom, com)), wbr(cxp(c0, c1), cdom, com), wbr(cxp(c0, c1), cdom, cxp(com, com)), wbr(cxp(com, com), cen, com))
  syl2anc(wa(wbr(c0, cdom, com), wbr(c1, cdom, com)), wbr(cxp(c0, c1), cdom, cxp(com, com)), wbr(cxp(c0, c1), cdom, cxp(com, c1)), wbr(cxp(com, c1), cdom, cxp(com, com)))
  syl2anc(wa(wbr(c0, cdom, com), wbr(c1, cdom, com)), wbr(cxp(c0, c1), cdom, cxp(com, c1)), wcel(c1, universe), wbr(c0, cdom, com))
  adantl(wbr(c0, cdom, com), wbr(c1, cdom, com), wcel(c1, universe))
  ctex(c1)
  simpl(wbr(c0, cdom, com), wbr(c1, cdom, com))
  xpdom1g(c1, universe, c0, com)
  adantl(wbr(c0, cdom, com), wbr(c1, cdom, com), wbr(cxp(com, c1), cdom, cxp(com, com)))
  xpdom2(c1, com, com)
  omex()
  domtr(cxp(c0, c1), cxp(com, c1), cxp(com, com))
  xpomen()
  domentr(cxp(c0, c1), cxp(com, com), com)
}

blocks.name: infxpidm2
blocks.content: The Cartesian product of an infinite set with itself is idempotent. This theorem provides the basis for infinite cardinal arithmetic. Proposition 10.40 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 95. See also ~ infxpidm . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Mar-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 29-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: infxpenc
blocks.content: A canonical version of ~ infxpen , by a completely different approach (although it uses ~ infxpen via ~ xpomen ). Using Cantor's normal form, we can show that ` A ^o B ` respects equinumerosity ( ~ oef1o ), so that all the steps of ` ( _om ^ W ) x. ( _om ^ W ) ~~ _om ^ ( 2 W ) ~~ ` ` ( _om ^ 2 ) ^ W ~~ _om ^ W ` can be verified using bijections to do the ordinal commutations. (The assumption on ` N ` can be satisfied using ~ cnfcom3c .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-May-2015.) (Revised by AV, 7-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: infxpenc2
blocks.content: Existence form of ~ infxpenc . A "uniform" or "canonical" version of ~ infxpen , asserting the existence of a single function ` g ` that simultaneously demonstrates product idempotence of all ordinals below a given bound. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm infxpenc2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, con0), wex(s0, wral(s1, c0, wi(wss(com, cv(s1)), wf1o(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cxp(cv(s1), cv(s1)), cv(s1))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  mp2and(wcel(c0, con0), wex(s0, wral(s1, c0, wi(wss(com, cv(s1)), wf1o(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cxp(cv(s1), cv(s1)), cv(s1))))), wex(hs2, wral(hs0, c0, wi(wss(com, cv(hs0)), wrex(hs1, cdif(con0, c1o), wf1o(cfv(cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), cv(hs0), co(com, coe, cv(hs1))))))), wex(hs3, wf1o(cv(hs3), co(com, coe, c2o), com)))
  cnfcom3c(hs2, hs0, hs1, c0)
  sylib(wcel(c0, con0), wex(hs3, wf1o(cv(hs3), co(com, coe, c2o), com)), wbr(co(com, coe, c2o), cen, com))
  a1i(wcel(c0, con0), wbr(co(com, coe, c2o), cen, com))
  entri(co(com, coe, c2o), com, cxp(com, com))
  eqbrtri(co(com, coe, c2o), cen, cxp(com, com), co(com, comu, com))
  3eqtri(co(com, coe, c2o), co(com, comu, com), co(com, coe, csuc(c1o)), co(co(com, coe, c1o), comu, com))
  oveq2i(com, coe, c2o, csuc(c1o))
  df-2o()
  mp2an(wceq(co(com, coe, csuc(c1o)), co(co(com, coe, c1o), comu, com)), wcel(com, con0), wcel(c1o, con0))
  1on()
  oesuc(com, c1o)
  oveq1i(co(com, coe, c1o), comu, com, com)
  ax-mp(wceq(co(com, coe, c1o), com), wcel(com, con0))
  oe1(com)
  mp2an(wbr(co(com, comu, com), cen, cxp(com, com)), wcel(com, con0), wcel(com, con0))
  omxpen(com, com)

blocks.name: iunmapdisj
blocks.content: The union ` U_ n e. C ( A ^m n ) ` is a disjoint union. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-May-2015.) (Revised by NM, 16-Jun-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm iunmapdisj(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wrmo(s0, c0, wcel(c1, co(c2, cmap, cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  mpbir(wrmo(s0, c0, wcel(c1, co(c2, cmap, cv(s0)))), wmo(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c1, co(c2, cmap, cv(s0))))))
  moani(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c1, co(c2, cmap, cv(s0))))
  ax-mp(wmo(s0, wcel(c1, co(c2, cmap, cv(s0)))), wmo(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cdm(c1))))
  moeq(s0, cdm(c1))
  moimi(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cdm(c1)), wcel(c1, co(c2, cmap, cv(s0))))
  syl(wcel(c1, co(c2, cmap, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s0), cdm(c1)), wf(c1, cv(s0), c2))
  elmapi(c1, c2, cv(s0))
  eqcomd(cv(s0), cdm(c1), wf(c1, cv(s0), c2))
  fdm(c1, cv(s0), c2)
  df-rmo(s0, c0, wcel(c1, co(c2, cmap, cv(s0))))
  diff.cdm.s(s0, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm iunmapdisj(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ ‚àÉ*(s0 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚àà(c2[‚Ü¶]s0))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  mpbir(‚àÉ*(s0 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚àà(c2[‚Ü¶]s0)), ‚àÉ*(s0,(s0 ‚àà c0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà(c2[‚Ü¶]s0))))
  moani(s0, s0 ‚àà c0, c1 ‚àà(c2[‚Ü¶]s0))
  ax-mp(‚àÉ*(s0, c1 ‚àà(c2[‚Ü¶]s0)), ‚àÉ*(s0, s0 = dom(c1)))
  moeq(s0, dom(c1))
  moimi(s0, s0 = dom(c1), c1 ‚àà(c2[‚Ü¶]s0))
  syl(c1 ‚àà(c2[‚Ü¶]s0), s0 = dom(c1), (c1 : s0 ‚Üí c2))
  elmapi(c1, c2, s0)
  eqcomd(s0, dom(c1), (c1 : s0 ‚Üí c2))
  fdm(c1, s0, c2)
  df-rmo(s0, c0, c1 ‚àà(c2[‚Ü¶]s0))
  diff.cdm.s(s0, c1)
}

blocks.name: fseqen

blocks.name: infpwfidom
blocks.content: The collection of finite subsets of a set dominates the set. (We use the weaker sethood assumption ` ( ~P A i^i Fin ) e. _V ` because this theorem also implies that ` A ` is a set if ` ~P A i^i Fin ` is.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm infpwfidom(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), universe), wbr(c0, cdom, cin(cpw(c0), cfn)))
} = {
  dom2(hs0, hs1, cin(cpw(c0), cfn), universe, c0, csn(cv(hs0)), csn(cv(hs1)))
  elind(csn(cv(hs0)), cpw(c0), cfn, wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
  snelpwi(cv(hs0), c0)
  a1i(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cfn))
  snfi(cv(hs0))
  adantr(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wb(wceq(csn(cv(hs0)), csn(cv(hs1))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  sneqbg(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(cin(cpw(c0), cfn))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(csn(cv(hs1)))
  diff.hs1.c(cin(cpw(c0), cfn))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(csn(cv(hs0)))
}

blocks.name: dfac8alem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ dfac8a . If the power set of a set has a choice function, then the set is numerable. (Contributed by NM, 10-Feb-1997.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 5-Jan-2013.)
blocks.origin:

  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wex(s0, wral(s1, cpw(c0), wi(wne(cv(s1), emptycls), wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cv(s1))))), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))), diffss(s1, s2))

  elex(c0, c1)

  ex(wcel(c0, universe), wral(s1, cpw(c0), wi(wne(cv(s1), emptycls), wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cv(s1)))), wral(hs0, con0, wi(wne(cdif(c0, cima(c2, cv(hs0))), emptycls), wcel(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cdif(c0, cima(c2, cv(hs0)))))))

blocks.name: dfac8a
blocks.content: Numeration theorem: every set with a choice function on its power set is numerable. With AC, this reduces to the statement that every set is numerable. Similar to Theorem 10.3 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 84. (Contributed by NM, 10-Feb-1997.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 5-Jan-2013.)

blocks.name: dfac8c
blocks.content: If the union of a set is well-orderable, then the set has a choice function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Jan-2013.)

blocks.name: ween

thm ween(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wex(s0, wwe(cv(s0), c0)))

} = {

  sylc(wex(s0, wwe(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c0, universe), wex(s0, wwe(cv(s0), cuni(cpw(c0)))))
  exlimiv(s0, wwe(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c0, universe))
  sylancl(wwe(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c0, universe), wor(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s0), universe))
  weso(cv(s0), c0)
  vex(s0)
  soex(cv(s0), c0, universe)
  biimpri(wex(s0, wwe(cv(s0), c0)), wex(s0, wwe(cv(s0), cuni(cpw(c0)))))
  exbii(s0, wwe(cv(s0), cuni(cpw(c0))), wwe(cv(s0), c0))
  ax-mp(wb(wwe(cv(s0), cuni(cpw(c0))), wwe(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cuni(cpw(c0)), c0))

blocks.name: ondomen
blocks.content: If a set is dominated by an ordinal, then it is numerable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Jan-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm ondomen(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wbr(c1, cdom, c0)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)))
} = {
  sylibr(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wbr(c1, cdom, c0)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)), wex(hs0, wwe(cv(hs0), c1)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wbr(c1, cdom, c0)), wex(hs0, wwe(cv(hs0), c1)), wrex(hs1, con0, wbr(c1, cdom, cv(hs1))))
  rspcev(hs1, c0, con0, wbr(c1, cdom, c0), wbr(c1, cdom, cv(hs1)))
  breq2(cv(hs1), c0, c1, cdom)
  ac10ct(hs1, hs0, c1)
  ween(hs0, c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(con0)
  diff.hs1.w(wbr(c1, cdom, c0))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

thm ondomen(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1[‚âº]c0)‚Üí c1 ‚àà dom(card))
} = {
  sylibr((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1[‚âº]c0), c1 ‚àà dom(card), ‚àÉ(hs0, hs0 ‚â§ c1))
  syl((c0 ‚àà On ‚àß c1[‚âº]c0), ‚àÉ(hs0, hs0 ‚â§ c1), ‚àÉ(hs1 ‚àà On, c1[‚âº]hs1))
  rspcev(hs1, c0, con0, c1[‚âº]c0, c1[‚âº]hs1)
  breq2(hs1, c0, c1, cdom)
  ac10ct(hs1, hs0, c1)
  ween(hs0, c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(con0)
  diff.hs1.w(c1[‚âº]c0)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)

blocks.name: numdom
blocks.content: A set dominated by a numerable set is numerable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: ssnum
blocks.content: A subset of a numerable set is numerable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: onssnum
blocks.content: All subsets of the ordinals are numerable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Feb-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm onssnum(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, con0)), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))
} = {
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, con0)), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(csuc(cuni(c0)), cdm(ccrd)), wss(c0, csuc(cuni(c0))))
  3syl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, con0)), wcel(csuc(cuni(c0)), cdm(ccrd)), wcel(cuni(c0), con0), wcel(csuc(cuni(c0)), con0))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, con0), wcel(cuni(c0), con0), wcel(cuni(c0), universe), word(cuni(c0)))
  uniexg(c0, c1)
  ssorduni(c0)
  biimpar(wcel(cuni(c0), universe), word(cuni(c0)), wcel(cuni(c0), con0))
  elong(cuni(c0), universe)
  suceloni(cuni(c0))
  onenon(csuc(cuni(c0)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wss(c0, con0), wss(c0, csuc(cuni(c0))))
  onsucuni(c0)
  ssnum(csuc(cuni(c0)), c0)
}

thm onssnum(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c0 ‚äÜ On)‚Üí c0 ‚àà dom(card))
} = {
  syl2anc((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c0 ‚äÜ On), c0 ‚àà dom(card), suc(‚ãÉ c0)‚àà dom(card), c0 ‚äÜ suc(‚ãÉ c0))
  3syl((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c0 ‚äÜ On), suc(‚ãÉ c0)‚àà dom(card), ‚ãÉ c0 ‚àà On, suc(‚ãÉ c0)‚àà On)

blocks.name: indcardi
blocks.content: Indirect strong induction on the cardinality of a finite or numerable set. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 24-Aug-2015.)

  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)

  mpd(w0, w1, wbr(c2, cdom, c2))

  cardon(c2)
  ex(w3a(w0, wa(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c3), con0), wss(cfv(ccrd, c3), cfv(ccrd, c2))), wal(s0, wi(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c4), cfv(ccrd, c3)), wi(wbr(c4, cdom, c2), w2)))), wbr(c3, cdom, c2), w3)
  syl3anc(wa(w3a(w0, wa(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c3), con0), wss(cfv(ccrd, c3), cfv(ccrd, c2))), wal(s0, wi(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c4), cfv(ccrd, c3)), wi(wbr(c4, cdom, c2), w2)))), wbr(c3, cdom, c2)), w3, w0, wbr(c3, cdom, c2), wal(s0, wi(wbr(c4, csdm, c3), w2)))

  simpr(w3a(w0, wa(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c3), con0), wss(cfv(ccrd, c3), cfv(ccrd, c2))), wal(s0, wi(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c4), cfv(ccrd, c3)), wi(wbr(c4, cdom, c2), w2)))), wbr(c3, cdom, c2))
  3imp1(w0, wa(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c3), con0), wss(cfv(ccrd, c3), cfv(ccrd, c2))), wal(s0, wi(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c4), cfv(ccrd, c3)), wi(wbr(c4, cdom, c2), w2))), wbr(c3, cdom, c2), wal(s0, wi(wbr(c4, csdm, c3), w2)))
  com34(w0, wa(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c3), con0), wss(cfv(ccrd, c3), cfv(ccrd, c2))), wal(s0, wi(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c4), cfv(ccrd, c3)), wi(wbr(c4, cdom, c2), w2))), wbr(c3, cdom, c2), wal(s0, wi(wbr(c4, csdm, c3), w2)))

  alimdv(s0, w3a(w0, wa(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c3), con0), wss(cfv(ccrd, c3), cfv(ccrd, c2))), wbr(c3, cdom, c2)), wi(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c4), cfv(ccrd, c3)), wi(wbr(c4, cdom, c2), w2)), wi(wbr(c4, csdm, c3), w2))

  simpr(w3a(w0, wa(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c3), con0), wss(cfv(ccrd, c3), cfv(ccrd, c2))), wbr(c3, cdom, c2)), wbr(c4, csdm, c3))
  syl2anc(wa(w3a(w0, wa(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c3), con0), wss(cfv(ccrd, c3), cfv(ccrd, c2))), wbr(c3, cdom, c2)), wbr(c4, csdm, c3)), wb(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c4), cfv(ccrd, c3)), wbr(c4, csdm, c3)), wcel(c4, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c3, cdm(ccrd)))
  syl2anc(wa(w3a(w0, wa(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c3), con0), wss(cfv(ccrd, c3), cfv(ccrd, c2))), wbr(c3, cdom, c2)), wbr(c4, csdm, c3)), wcel(c4, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c2, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(c4, cdom, c2))
  numdom(c2, c4)

  syl(wa(w3a(w0, wa(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c3), con0), wss(cfv(ccrd, c3), cfv(ccrd, c2))), wbr(c3, cdom, c2)), wbr(c4, csdm, c3)), wcel(c2, cdm(ccrd)), w0)

  sdomdom(c4, c3)
  simpl3(w0, wa(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c3), con0), wss(cfv(ccrd, c3), cfv(ccrd, c2))), wbr(c3, cdom, c2), wbr(c4, csdm, c3))
  domtr(c4, c3, c2)
  com3l(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c4), cfv(ccrd, c3)), wbr(c4, cdom, c2), wi(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c4), cfv(ccrd, c3)), wi(wbr(c4, cdom, c2), w2)), w2)
  id(wi(wcel(cfv(ccrd, c4), cfv(ccrd, c3)), wi(wbr(c4, cdom, c2), w2)))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wbr(c3, cdom, c2), w3, wbr(c4, cdom, c2), w2)

blocks.pretty:
thm indcardi(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí w1)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c1)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà dom(card))
  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß c3[‚âº]c2 ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0,(c4[‚â∫]c3 ‚Üí w2)))‚Üí w3)
  ‚ä£ (s1 = s0 ‚Üí(w3 ‚Üî w2))
  ‚ä£ (s1 = c0 ‚Üí(w3 ‚Üî w1))
  ‚ä£ (s1 = s0 ‚Üí c3 = c4)
  ‚ä£ (s1 = c0 ‚Üí c3 = c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, w1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, w2)
} = {
  mpd(w0, w1, c2[‚âº]c2)
  syl(w0, c2[‚âº]c2, c2 ‚àà dom(card))
  domrefg(c2, dom(card))
  tfisi(s0, s1, c0, c1, (card ` c2), (card ` c3), (card ` c4), w0, (c2[‚âº]c2 ‚Üí w1), (c4[‚âº]c2 ‚Üí w2), (c3[‚âº]c2 ‚Üí w3))

  anbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(c2, universe), wral(s0, co(cdif(cpw(cv(hs0)), csn(emptycls)), cmap, c2), wex(s1, wral(s2, c2, wcel(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)), cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))), wral(s0, co(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), cmap, c2), wex(s1, wral(s2, c2, wcel(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)), cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))))

  biid(wa(wcel(c2, universe), wral(s0, co(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), cmap, c2), wex(s1, wral(s2, c2, wcel(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)), cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2))))))))

thm isacn(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚Üí(c0 ‚àà AC(c2)‚Üî ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2))))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚Üí(c0 ‚àà AC(c2)‚Üî ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2)))))), d(s1, c0))
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c3)‚Üí(c0 ‚àà AC(c2)‚Üî ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2)))))), d(s2, c0))
  sylan9bb(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà c3, c0 ‚àà AC(c2), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2)))), (c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2))))))
  elab2g(hs0, c0, c1, AC(c2), (c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2))))), (c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(hs0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2))))))
  anbi2d(hs0 = c0, c2 ‚àà ùïå, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(hs0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2)))), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2)))))
  raleqdv(s0, ((P(hs0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), hs0 = c0, ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2))))
  oveq1d((P(hs0)\ { ‚àÖ }), cmap, c2, (P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ }), hs0 = c0)
  difeq1d(P(hs0), { ‚àÖ }, P(c0), hs0 = c0)
  pweq(hs0, c0)
  df-acn(hs0, s0, s1, s2, c2)
  syl(c2 ‚àà c3, ((c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2)))))‚Üî ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2))))), c2 ‚àà ùïå)
  elex(c2, c3)

  biid((c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2))))))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w((c2 ‚àà ùïå ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c2), ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c2,(s1 ` s2)‚àà(s0 ` s2))))))

thm acni(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wf(c2, c1, cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)))), wex(s0, wral(s1, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(c2, cv(s1))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  rspcdva(hs0, c2, co(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), cmap, c1), wa(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wf(c2, c1, cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)))), wex(s0, wral(s1, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(c2, cv(s1))))), wex(s0, wral(s1, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s1))))))
  exbidv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wral(s1, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), wral(s1, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(c2, cv(s1)))))
  ralbidv(s1, c1, wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(c2, cv(s1))))
  eleq2d(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), cfv(c2, cv(s1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c2))
  fveq1(cv(hs0), c2, cv(s1))
  adantr(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wf(c2, c1, cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls))), wral(hs0, co(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), cmap, c1), wex(s0, wral(s1, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))))))
  ibi(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wral(hs0, co(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), cmap, c1), wex(s0, wral(s1, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))))))
  mpdan(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wb(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wral(hs0, co(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), cmap, c1), wex(s0, wral(s1, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s1))))))), wcel(c1, universe))
  isacn(hs0, s0, s1, c0, wacn(c1), c1, universe)
  biimpar(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wf(c2, c1, cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls))), wcel(c2, co(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), cmap, c1)))
  elmapd(c2, cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), c1, universe, universe, wcel(c0, wacn(c1)))
  syl(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wcel(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), universe), wcel(cpw(c0), universe))
  pwexg(c0, wacn(c1))
  difexg(cpw(c0), universe, csn(emptycls))
  acnrcl(c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(co(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), cmap, c1))
  diff.hs0.w(wex(s0, wral(s1, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1)), cfv(c2, cv(s1))))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), c2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
}

thm acni(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà AC(c1)‚àß(c2 : c1 ‚Üí(P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })))‚Üí ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(s0 ` s1)‚àà(c2 ` s1))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
} = {
  rspcdva(hs0, c2, ((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c1), (c0 ‚àà AC(c1)‚àß(c2 : c1 ‚Üí(P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ }))), ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(s0 ` s1)‚àà(c2 ` s1))), ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(s0 ` s1)‚àà(hs0 ` s1))))
  exbidv(s0, hs0 = c2, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(s0 ` s1)‚àà(hs0 ` s1)), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(s0 ` s1)‚àà(c2 ` s1)))
  ralbidv(s1, c1, hs0 = c2, (s0 ` s1)‚àà(hs0 ` s1), (s0 ` s1)‚àà(c2 ` s1))
  eleq2d((s0 ` s1), (hs0 ` s1), (c2 ` s1), hs0 = c2)
  fveq1(hs0, c2, s1)
  adantr(c0 ‚àà AC(c1), (c2 : c1 ‚Üí(P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c1), ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(s0 ` s1)‚àà(hs0 ` s1)))))
  ibi(c0 ‚àà AC(c1), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c1), ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(s0 ` s1)‚àà(hs0 ` s1)))))
  mpdan(c0 ‚àà AC(c1), (c0 ‚àà AC(c1)‚Üî ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c1), ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(s0 ` s1)‚àà(hs0 ` s1))))), c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  isacn(hs0, s0, s1, c0, AC(c1), c1, universe)
  biimpar(c0 ‚àà AC(c1), (c2 : c1 ‚Üí(P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })), c2 ‚àà((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c1))
  elmapd(c2, (P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ }), c1, universe, universe, c0 ‚àà AC(c1))
  syl(c0 ‚àà AC(c1), (P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })‚àà ùïå, P(c0)‚àà ùïå)
  pwexg(c0, AC(c1))
  difexg(P(c0), universe, { ‚àÖ })
  acnrcl(c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(((P(c0)\ { ‚àÖ })[‚Ü¶]c1))
  diff.hs0.w(‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(s0 ` s1)‚àà(c2 ` s1))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c2)

thm acni2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wral(s0, c1, wa(wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls)))), wex(s1, wa(wf(cv(s1), c1, c0), wral(s0, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s0)), c2)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  mpd(wa(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wral(s0, c1, wa(wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls)))), wex(s1, wa(wf(cv(s1), c1, c0), wral(s0, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s0)), c2)))), wex(hs1, wral(hs0, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), cfv(cmpt(s0, c1, c2), cv(hs0))))))
  syldan(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wral(s0, c1, wa(wss(c2, c0), wne(c2, emptycls))), wex(hs1, wral(hs0, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), cfv(cmpt(s0, c1, c2), cv(hs0))))), wf(cmpt(s0, c1, c2), c1, cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls))))

blocks.name: acni3
blocks.content: The property of being a choice set of length ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm acni3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wral(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c0, w0))), wex(s2, wa(wf(cv(s2), c1, c0), wral(s0, c1, w1))))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s1), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s0))), wb(w0, w1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wral(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c0, w0))), wex(s2, wa(wf(cv(s2), c1, c0), wral(s0, c1, w1)))), diffsc(s1, c1))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wral(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c0, w0))), wex(s2, wa(wf(cv(s2), c1, c0), wral(s0, c1, w1))), wex(s2, wa(wf(cv(s2), c1, c0), wral(s0, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s0)), crab(s1, c0, w0))))))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, wacn(c1)), wral(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c0, w0)), wex(s2, wa(wf(cv(s2), c1, c0), wral(s0, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s0)), crab(s1, c0, w0))))), wral(s0, c1, wa(wss(crab(s1, c0, w0), c0), wne(crab(s1, c0, w0), emptycls))))
  ralimi(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c0, w0), wa(wss(crab(s1, c0, w0), c0), wne(crab(s1, c0, w0), emptycls)))
  jctil(wrex(s1, c0, w0), wss(crab(s1, c0, w0), c0), wne(crab(s1, c0, w0), emptycls))
  biimpri(wrex(s1, c0, w0), wne(crab(s1, c0, w0), emptycls))
  rabn0(s1, c0, w0)
  ssrab2(s1, c0, w0)
  acni2(s0, s2, c0, c1, crab(s1, c0, w0))
  eximi(s2, wa(wf(cv(s2), c1, c0), wral(s0, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s0)), crab(s1, c0, w0)))), wa(wf(cv(s2), c1, c0), wral(s0, c1, w1)))
  anim2i(wf(cv(s2), c1, c0), wral(s0, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s0)), crab(s1, c0, w0))), wral(s0, c1, w1))
  ralimi(s0, c1, wcel(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s0)), crab(s1, c0, w0)), w1)
  simprbi(wcel(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s0)), crab(s1, c0, w0)), w1, wcel(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s0)), c0))
  elrab(s1, cfv(cv(s2), cv(s0)), c0, w0, w1)
  diff.crab.s(s2, s1, c0, w0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cv(s2), cv(s0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà AC(c1)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c0, w0)))‚Üí ‚àÉ(s2,((s2 : c1 ‚Üí c0)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, w1))))
  ‚ä£ (s1 =(s2 ` s0)‚Üí(w0 ‚Üî w1))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)

  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, w1)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà AC(c1)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c0, w0)))‚Üí ‚àÉ(s2,((s2 : c1 ‚Üí c0)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, w1)))), d(s1, c1))
  syl((c0 ‚àà AC(c1)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c0, w0))), ‚àÉ(s2,((s2 : c1 ‚Üí c0)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, w1))), ‚àÉ(s2,((s2 : c1 ‚Üí c0)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1,(s2 ` s0)‚àà { s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 }))))
  sylan2(c0 ‚àà AC(c1), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c0, w0)), ‚àÉ(s2,((s2 : c1 ‚Üí c0)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1,(s2 ` s0)‚àà { s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 }))), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1,({ s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 } ‚äÜ c0 ‚àß { s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 } ‚â† ‚àÖ)))
  ralimi(s0, c1, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c0, w0), ({ s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 } ‚äÜ c0 ‚àß { s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 } ‚â† ‚àÖ))
  jctil(‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c0, w0), { s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 } ‚äÜ c0, { s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 } ‚â† ‚àÖ)
  biimpri(‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà c0, w0), { s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 } ‚â† ‚àÖ)
  rabn0(s1, c0, w0)
  ssrab2(s1, c0, w0)
  acni2(s0, s2, c0, c1, { s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 })
  eximi(s2, ((s2 : c1 ‚Üí c0)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1,(s2 ` s0)‚àà { s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 })), ((s2 : c1 ‚Üí c0)‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, w1)))
  anim2i((s2 : c1 ‚Üí c0), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1,(s2 ` s0)‚àà { s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 }), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, w1))
  ralimi(s0, c1, (s2 ` s0)‚àà { s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 }, w1)
  simprbi((s2 ` s0)‚àà { s1 ‚àà c0 | w0 }, w1, (s2 ` s0)‚àà c0)
  elrab(s1, (s2 ` s0), c0, w0, w1)
  diff.crab.s(s2, s1, c0, w0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, s2, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: acnlem
blocks.content: Construct a mapping satisfying the consequent of ~ isacn . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm acnlem(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wcel(c2, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wex(s2, wral(s0, c0, wcel(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c2 ‚àà(s1 ` s0)))‚Üí ‚àÉ(s2, ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0,(s2 ` s0)‚àà(s1 ` s0))))

  sylib(‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c2 ‚àà(s1 ` s0)), ((s0 ‚àà c0 ‚Ü¶ c2): c0 ‚Üí ‚ãÉ ran(s1)), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, c2 ‚àà ‚ãÉ ran(s1)))

blocks.name: acndom

blocks.name: acnnum
blocks.content: A set ` X ` which has choice sequences on it of length ` ~P X ` is well-orderable (and hence has choice sequences of every length). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm acnnum(class c0) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, wacn(cpw(c0))), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))
} = {
  impbii(wcel(c0, wacn(cpw(c0))), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))
  mpd(wcel(c0, wacn(cpw(c0))), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wex(hs1, wral(hs0, cpw(c0), wi(wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wcel(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs0))))))
  syl(wcel(c0, wacn(cpw(c0))), wex(hs1, wral(hs0, cpw(c0), wi(wne(cv(hs0), emptycls), wcel(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs0))))), wex(hs1, wa(wf(cv(hs1), cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), c0), wral(hs0, cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), wcel(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs0))))))
  sylancl(wcel(c0, wacn(cpw(c0))), wex(hs1, wa(wf(cv(hs1), cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), c0), wral(hs0, cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), wcel(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs0))))), wcel(c0, wacn(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)))), wral(hs0, cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), wa(wss(cv(hs0), c0), wne(cv(hs0), emptycls))))
  mpcom(wcel(c0, wacn(cpw(c0))), wcel(c0, wacn(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)))), wbr(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), cdom, cpw(c0)))
  mpisyl(wcel(c0, wacn(cpw(c0))), wbr(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), cdom, cpw(c0)), wcel(cpw(c0), universe), wss(cdif(cpw(c0), csn(emptycls)), cpw(c0)))
  pwexg(c0, wacn(cpw(c0)))

blocks.name: acnen2
blocks.content: The class of sets with choice sequences of length ` A ` is a cardinal invariant. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: fodomacn
blocks.content: A version of ~ fodom that doesn't require the Axiom of Choice ~ ax-ac . If ` A ` has choice sequences of length ` B ` , then any surjection from ` A ` to ` B ` can be inverted to an injection the other way. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)

  jaodan(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wceq(c1, emptycls), wex(hs0, wfo(cv(hs0), c0, c1)), wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)))
  syl6eqel(c1, cdm(ccrd), emptycls, wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wceq(c1, emptycls)))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wceq(c1, emptycls))

  0fin()

  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c1, cdm(ccrd)))
}

thm fodomfi2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wbr(c2, cdom, c0))
} = {
  mpd(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wbr(c2, cdom, c0), wrex(hs0, cin(cpw(c0), cfn), wceq(cima(c3, cv(hs0)), c2)))
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wrex(hs0, cin(cpw(c0), cfn), wceq(cima(c3, cv(hs0)), c2)), wfn(c3, c0), wss(c2, crn(c3)), wcel(c2, cfn))
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2), wfn(c3, c0))
  fofn(c3, c0, c2)
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2), wss(c2, crn(c3)))

  simp2(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2))
  fipreima(hs0, c3, c0, c2)
  rexlimdva(hs0, cin(cpw(c0), cfn), w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wceq(cima(c3, cv(hs0)), c2), wbr(c2, cdom, c0))
  syl5ibcom(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn))), wceq(cima(c3, cv(hs0)), c2), wbr(c2, cdom, c0), wbr(cima(c3, cv(hs0)), cdom, c0))
  syl2anc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn))), wbr(cima(c3, cv(hs0)), cdom, c0), wbr(cima(c3, cv(hs0)), cdom, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cdom, c0))
  sylc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn))), wbr(cima(c3, cv(hs0)), cdom, cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(ccrd)), wfo(cres(c3, cv(hs0)), cv(hs0), cima(c3, cv(hs0))))
  syl(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn))), wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(ccrd)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  adantl(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  elinel2(cv(hs0), cpw(c0), cfn)
  finnum(cv(hs0))
  syl2anc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn))), wfo(cres(c3, cv(hs0)), cv(hs0), cima(c3, cv(hs0))), wfun(c3), wss(cv(hs0), cdm(c3)))
  syl(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn))), wfun(c3), wfo(c3, c0, c2))
  fofun(c3, c0, c2)
  sseqtr4d(cv(hs0), cdm(c3), c0, wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn))))
  3syl(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn))), wceq(cdm(c3), c0), wfo(c3, c0, c2), wf(c3, c0, c2))
  simpl3(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn)))
  fof(c3, c0, c2)
  fdm(c3, c0, c2)
  fores(c3, cv(hs0))
  fodomnum(cv(hs0), cres(c3, cv(hs0)), cima(c3, cv(hs0)))
  sylc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn))), wbr(cv(hs0), cdom, c0), wcel(c0, c1), wss(cv(hs0), c0))
  simpl1(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn)))
  adantl(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn)), wss(cv(hs0), c0))
  elpwid(cv(hs0), c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cin(cpw(c0), cfn)))

  ssdomg(c0, c1, cv(hs0))
  domtr(cima(c3, cv(hs0)), cv(hs0), c0)
  breq1(cima(c3, cv(hs0)), c2, cdom, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfn), wfo(c3, c0, c2)))

}

thm fodomfi2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2))‚Üí c2[‚âº]c0)
} = {
  mpd((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2)), c2[‚âº]c0, ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà(P(c0)‚ãÇ Fin),(c3 " hs0)= c2))
  syl3anc((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2)), ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà(P(c0)‚ãÇ Fin),(c3 " hs0)= c2), c3[Fn]c0, c2 ‚äÜ ran(c3), c2 ‚àà Fin)
  3ad2ant3(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà Fin, (c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2), c3[Fn]c0)
  fofn(c3, c0, c2)
  3ad2ant3(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà Fin, (c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2), c2 ‚äÜ ran(c3))
  syl((c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2), c2 ‚äÜ ran(c3), ran(c3)= c2)
  forn(c3, c0, c2)
  eqimss2(ran(c3), c2)
  simp2(c0 ‚àà c1, c2 ‚àà Fin, (c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2))
  fipreima(hs0, c3, c0, c2)
  rexlimdva(hs0, (P(c0)‚ãÇ Fin), (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2)), (c3 " hs0)= c2, c2[‚âº]c0)
  syl5ibcom(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2))‚àß hs0 ‚àà(P(c0)‚ãÇ Fin)), (c3 " hs0)= c2, c2[‚âº]c0, (c3 " hs0)[‚âº]c0)
  syl2anc(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2))‚àß hs0 ‚àà(P(c0)‚ãÇ Fin)), (c3 " hs0)[‚âº]c0, (c3 " hs0)[‚âº]hs0, hs0[‚âº]c0)
  sylc(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2))‚àß hs0 ‚àà(P(c0)‚ãÇ Fin)), (c3 " hs0)[‚âº]hs0, hs0 ‚àà dom(card), ((c3 |` hs0): hs0 ‚Ü†(c3 " hs0)))
  syl(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2))‚àß hs0 ‚àà(P(c0)‚ãÇ Fin)), hs0 ‚àà dom(card), hs0 ‚àà Fin)
  adantl((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2)), hs0 ‚àà(P(c0)‚ãÇ Fin), hs0 ‚àà Fin)
  elinel2(hs0, P(c0), cfn)
  finnum(hs0)
  syl2anc(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2))‚àß hs0 ‚àà(P(c0)‚ãÇ Fin)), ((c3 |` hs0): hs0 ‚Ü†(c3 " hs0)), Fun(c3), hs0 ‚äÜ dom(c3))
  syl(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2))‚àß hs0 ‚àà(P(c0)‚ãÇ Fin)), Fun(c3), (c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2))
  fofun(c3, c0, c2)
  sseqtr4d(hs0, dom(c3), c0, ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2))‚àß hs0 ‚àà(P(c0)‚ãÇ Fin)))
  3syl(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà Fin ‚àß(c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2))‚àß hs0 ‚àà(P(c0)‚ãÇ Fin)), dom(c3)= c0, (c3 : c0 ‚Ü† c2), (c3 : c0 ‚Üí c2))

blocks.name: wdomfil
blocks.content: Weak dominance agrees with normal for finite left sets. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 28-Feb-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm wdomfil(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfn), wb(wbr(c0, cwdom, c1), wbr(c0, cdom, c1)))
} = {
  impbid1(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, cwdom, c1), wbr(c0, cdom, c1))
  pm2.61dane(c0, emptycls, wcel(c0, cfn), wi(wbr(c0, cwdom, c1), wbr(c0, cdom, c1)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfn), wceq(c0, emptycls), wi(wbr(c0, cwdom, c1), wbr(c0, cdom, c1)))
  syl5ibr(wceq(c0, emptycls), wbr(c0, cwdom, c1), wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wbr(emptycls, cdom, c1))
  syl(wbr(c0, cwdom, c1), wbr(emptycls, cdom, c1), wcel(c1, universe))
  brrelex2i(c0, cwdom, c1)
  relwdom()
  0domg(c1, universe)
  breq1(c0, emptycls, cdom, c1)
  sylbid(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls)), wbr(c0, cwdom, c1), wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wex(hs0, wfo(cv(hs0), c1, c0)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls), wb(wbr(c0, cwdom, c1), wex(hs0, wfo(cv(hs0), c1, c0))))
  brwdomn0(hs0, c0, c1)
  exlimdv(hs0, wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls)), wfo(cv(hs0), c1, c0), wbr(c0, cdom, c1))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls), wi(wfo(cv(hs0), c1, c0), wbr(c0, cdom, c1)))
  ex(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(cv(hs0), c1, c0), wbr(c0, cdom, c1))
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(cv(hs0), c1, c0)), wbr(c0, cdom, c1), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(cv(hs0), c1, c0))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(cv(hs0), c1, c0), wcel(c1, universe))
  sylancr(wfo(cv(hs0), c1, c0), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wf(cv(hs0), c1, c0))
  vex(hs0)
  fof(cv(hs0), c1, c0)
  dmfex(cv(hs0), universe, c1, c0)
  simpl(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(cv(hs0), c1, c0))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(cv(hs0), c1, c0))
  fodomfi2(c1, universe, c0, cv(hs0))
  domwdom(c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wne(c0, emptycls)))
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c0, cdom, c1))
}

thm wdomfil(class c0, class c1) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚Üí(c0[‚âº*]c1 ‚Üî c0[‚âº]c1))
} = {

  brwdomn0(hs0, c0, c1)
  exlimdv(hs0, (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ), (hs0 : c1 ‚Ü† c0), c0[‚âº]c1)
  adantr(c0 ‚àà Fin, c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ, ((hs0 : c1 ‚Ü† c0)‚Üí c0[‚âº]c1))

  adantl(c0 ‚àà Fin, (hs0 : c1 ‚Ü† c0), c1 ‚àà ùïå)
  sylancr((hs0 : c1 ‚Ü† c0), c1 ‚àà ùïå, hs0 ‚àà ùïå, (hs0 : c1 ‚Üí c0))
  vex(hs0)
  fof(hs0, c1, c0)
  dmfex(hs0, universe, c1, c0)
  simpl(c0 ‚àà Fin, (hs0 : c1 ‚Ü† c0))
  simpr(c0 ‚àà Fin, (hs0 : c1 ‚Ü† c0))

  domwdom(c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ))
  diff.hs0.w(c0[‚âº]c1)
}

blocks.name: infpwfien
blocks.content: Any infinite well-orderable set is equinumerous to its set of finite subsets. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm infpwfien(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(com, cdom, c0)), wbr(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), cen, c0))
} = {
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(com, cdom, c0)), wbr(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), cen, c0), wbr(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), cdom, c0), wbr(c0, cdom, cin(cpw(c0), cfn)))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(com, cdom, c0)), wbr(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), cdom, c0), wbr(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), cdom, ciun(hs0, com, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)))), wbr(ciun(hs0, com, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0))), cdom, c0))
  sylc(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(com, cdom, c0)), wbr(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), cdom, ciun(hs0, com, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0)))), wcel(ciun(hs0, com, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0))), cdm(ccrd)), wfo(cmpt(hs1, ciun(hs0, com, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0))), crn(cv(hs1))), ciun(hs0, com, co(c0, cmap, cv(hs0))), cin(cpw(c0), cfn)))

blocks.name: inffien
blocks.content: The set of finite intersections of an infinite well-orderable set is equinumerous to the set itself. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm inffien(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(com, cdom, c0)), wbr(cfv(cfi, c0), cen, c0))
} = {
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(com, cdom, c0)), wbr(cfv(cfi, c0), cen, c0), wbr(cfv(cfi, c0), cdom, c0), wbr(c0, cdom, cfv(cfi, c0)))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(com, cdom, c0)), wbr(cfv(cfi, c0), cdom, c0), wbr(cfv(cfi, c0), cdom, cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls))), wbr(cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cdom, c0))
  sylc(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(com, cdom, c0)), wbr(cfv(cfi, c0), cdom, cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls))), wcel(cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cdm(ccrd)), wfo(cmpt(hs0, cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cint(cv(hs0))), cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cfv(cfi, c0)))
  syldan(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(com, cdom, c0), wcel(cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cdm(ccrd)), wbr(cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cdom, c0))
  numdom(c0, cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(com, cdom, c0), wfo(cmpt(hs0, cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cint(cv(hs0))), cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cfv(cfi, c0)))
  fifo(hs0, c0, cdm(ccrd), cmpt(hs0, cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cint(cv(hs0))))
  eqid(cmpt(hs0, cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cint(cv(hs0))))
  fodomnum(cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cmpt(hs0, cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cint(cv(hs0))), cfv(cfi, c0))
  syl2anc(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(com, cdom, c0)), wbr(cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cdom, c0), wbr(cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cdom, cin(cpw(c0), cfn)), wbr(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), cen, c0))
  mpisyl(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(com, cdom, c0)), wbr(cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cdom, cin(cpw(c0), cfn)), wcel(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), universe), wss(cdif(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), csn(emptycls)), cin(cpw(c0), cfn)))

blocks.name: alephfnon
blocks.content: The aleph function is a function on the class of ordinal numbers. (Contributed by NM, 21-Oct-2003.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: aleph0
blocks.content: The first infinite cardinal number, discovered by Georg Cantor in 1873, has the same size as the set of natural numbers ` _om ` (and under our particular definition is also equal to it). In the literature, the argument of the aleph function is often written as a subscript, and the first aleph is written ` aleph ` _0. Exercise 3 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 91. Also Definition 12(i) of [Suppes] p. 228. From Mosh&eacute Machover, _Set Theory, Logic, and Their Limitations_, p. 95: "Aleph...the first letter in the Hebrew alphabet...is also the first letter of the Hebrew word...(_einsoph_, meaning infinity), which is a cabbalistic appellation of the deity. The notation is due to Cantor, who was deeply interested in mysticism." (Contributed by NM, 21-Oct-2003.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: alephlim
blocks.content: Value of the aleph function at a limit ordinal. Definition 12(iii) of [Suppes] p. 91. (Contributed by NM, 21-Oct-2003.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2013.)

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  3eqtr4g(cfv(cale, c0), ciun(s0, c0, cfv(cale, cv(s0))), cfv(crdg(char, com), c0), ciun(s0, c0, cfv(crdg(char, com), cv(s0))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wlim(c0)))
  rdglim2a(s0, c0, c1, char, com)
  fveq1i(cale, c0, crdg(char, com))
  iuneq2i(s0, c0, cfv(cale, cv(s0)), cfv(crdg(char, com), cv(s0)))
  a1i(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cfv(cale, cv(s0)), cfv(crdg(char, com), cv(s0))))
  fveq1i(cale, cv(s0), crdg(char, com))
  df-aleph()
  diff.char.s(s0)
  diff.com.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: alephsuc
blocks.content: Value of the aleph function at a successor ordinal. Definition 12(ii) of [Suppes] p. 91. Here we express the successor aleph in terms of the Hartogs function ~ df-har , which gives the smallest ordinal that strictly dominates its argument (or the supremum of all ordinals that are dominated by the argument). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-May-2015.)

thm alephord(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c1, con0)), wb(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(cfv(cale, c0), csdm, cfv(cale, c1))))
